oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WEAKLY NON-GAUSSIAN MODEL OF WAVE HEIGHT DISTRIBUTION FOR NONLINEAR RANDOM WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mori, Nobuhito
Yasuda, Takashi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: random waves
non-Gaussian model
height distribution
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The wave height distribution with Edgeworth's form of a cumulative expansion of probability density function(PDF) of surface elevation are investigated. The results show that a non-Gaussian model of wave height distribution reasonably agrees with experimental data. It is discussed that the fourth order moment(kurtosis) of water surface elevation corresponds to the first order nonlinear correction of wave heights and is related with wave grouping.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
